attributes.action: Welwyn Hatfield Council should keep the Hatfield Night Shelter open all year.
attributes.additional_details:
Founded by the late Councillor Lynne Sparks and others, this shelter along with Resolve and Hatfield Fire Station, is due to shut its doors on 10th March.  This cannot happen.

We have done so much good, some of the guests have moved on after securing jobs and accommodation, but more people need help. The Shelter needs to stay open, but we need somewhere with beds, a kitchen and an indoor bathroom.

Welwyn Hatfield Council, please do the right thing.  You have the funds to help so many.
attributes.background:
We would like Welwyn Hatfield Council to keep the Hatfield Night Shelter open all year, in memory of the late Cllr Lynne Sparks.

Father Darren kindly opened the doors of The Church of St Luke in November, giving our guests a roof and a safe place to stay.  We have a home.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can petition the council here:

http://www.welhat.gov.uk/article/6693/ePetitions
